page.title: 15FARMING.
page.content: Coppice Farm keeps animals and grows crops.The machines they use are for milking,tractors and bailers.The most expensive machine is the tractor.They own 40 acres of land,30 for growing crops and 10 for grazing animals.Only family work on the farm but casual labourers work in the summer.The farmer doesn't have a lot of time to spend with his family.The summer months are busiest for the farmer. Coppice Farm keeps 50 cows which are kept for what they produce and are slaughtered between 2_6 years.20 calves are born each year.The cows are friesans and they are fed on hay and grass.Each cow produces 1000 gallons of milk a year which is retailed, bottled and sent to the dairy.Coppice Farm grows grass which is made into hay for the cows to eat.The grass seeds are sown in September and June.
